description: pre- +â€Ž cognize or back-formed from precognizance, precognition.

verbs.description: precognize (third-person singular simple present precognizes, present participle precognizing, simple past and past participle precognized)

entries.meaning: To display or have precognition; to have (paranormal) knowledge of a future event before it occurs.
examples: One fact of importance is that so far as the evidence goes we do not precognize the whole of our future. Why is this? It may have the same sort of explanation as the fact that we do not remember the whole of our past.
